caption: Attribute Dictionary
description: The Attribute Dictionary defines attributes and includes references to the events and objects in which they are used.
name: dictionary

acp.caption: Agent Connect Protocol Specs
acp.description: Specification of agent capabilities, config, input, output, and interrupts.

agent.caption: Agent
agent.description: An Agent (also known as a Sensor) is typically installed on an Operating System (OS) and serves as a specialized software component that can be designed to monitor, detect, collect, archive, or take action. These activities and possible actions are defined by the upstream system controlling the Agent and its intended purpose. For instance, an Agent can include Endpoint Detection & Response (EDR) agents, backup/disaster recovery sensors, Application Performance Monitoring or profiling sensors, and similar software.

agent_deployment.caption: Agent Workflow Server Deployment Manifest
agent_deployment.description: Describe all the details needed to deploy an agent by the Agent Workflow Server.

agent_list.caption: Agent List
agent_list.description: A list of agent objects associated with a device, endpoint, or resource.

algorithm.caption: Algorithm
algorithm.description: The applicable algorithm, normalized to the caption of 'algorithm_id'. See specific usage.

algorithm_id.caption: Algorithm ID
algorithm_id.description: The normalized identifier of the algorithm. See specific usage.

99.caption: Other
99.description: The algorithm is not mapped. See the algorithm attribute, which contains a data source specific value.

annotations.caption: Annotations
annotations.description: Provides additional metadata associated with this release manifest.

authentication.caption: Authentication
authentication.description: This object contains an instance of an OpenAPI schema object, formatted as per the OpenAPI specs: Security Scheme Object.

authors.caption: Author
authors.description: Specifies the authors list of an agent. Values inside the list should satisfy the following grammar: author := author-name .

callbacks.caption: Callback Support
callbacks.description: This is `true` if the agent supports a webhook to report run results. If this is `false`, providing a `webhook` at run creation has no effect. If missing, it means `false`.

capabilities.caption: Capabilities
capabilities.description: Declares what invocation features this agent is capable of.

category.caption: Category
category.description: The object category, normalized to the caption of category_id. See specific usage.

category_id.caption: Category ID
category_id.description: The normalized identifier of the object category. See specific usage.

category_name.caption: Category
category_name.description: The event category name, as defined by category_uid value.

category_uid.caption: Category ID
category_uid.description: The category unique identifier of the event.

class.caption: Class
class.description: The class name of the object. See specific usage.

class_name.caption: Class
class_name.description: The class name, as defined by class_uid value.

class_uid.caption: Class ID
class_uid.description: The unique identifier of a class. A class describes the attributes available in an event.

classification.caption: Classification
classification.description: The classification as defined by the vendor.

classification_ids.caption: Classification IDs
classification_ids.description: The list of normalized classification identifiers. See specific usage.

99.caption: Other
99.description: The classification is not mapped. See the classifications attribute, which contains a data source specific value.

classifications.caption: Classifications
classifications.description: The list of malware classifications, normalized to the captions of the classification_id values. In the case of 'Other', they are defined by the event source.

config.caption: Configuration
config.description: This object contains an instance of an OpenAPI schema object.

created_at.caption: Created Time
created_at.description: The time when the object was created. See specific usage.

custom_objects_streaming.caption: Custom Objects Streaming
custom_objects_streaming.description: This is `true` if the agent supports custom objects streaming. If `false` or missing, custom streaming is not supported. Custom Objects streaming consists of a stream of object whose schema is specified by the agent in its manifest under `specs.custom_streaming_update`.

custom_streaming_update.caption: Custom Streaming Update
custom_streaming_update.description: This describes the format of an Update in the streaming. Must be specified if `streaming.custom` capability is true and cannot be specified otherwise. Format follows: Schema Object.

dependencies.caption: Agent Dependencies
dependencies.description: List of all other agents this agent depends on.

deployment_options.caption: Deployment Options
deployment_options.description: List of possible methods to instantiate or consume the agent.  Any of the available option could be used. Every option could be associated with a unique name within this agent. If present, when another manifest refers to this manifest, it can also select the preferred deployment option.

digest.caption: Digest
digest.description: The digest of the targeted content, conforming to the requirements. Retrieved content SHOULD be verified against this digest when consumed via untrusted sources. The digest property acts as a content identifier, enabling content addressability. It uniquely identifies content by taking a collision-resistant hash of the bytes. If the digest can be communicated in a secure manner, one can verify content from an insecure source by recalculating the digest independently, ensuring the content has not been modified. The value of the digest property is a string consisting of an algorithm portion and an encoded portion. The algorithm specifies the cryptographic hash function and encoding used for the digest; the encoded portion contains the encoded result of the hash function. A digest MUST be calculated for all properties except the digest itself which MUST be ignored during the calculation. The model SHOULD then be updated with the calculated digest.

image.caption: Docker Image
image.description: The Docker image that pertains to the event or object. See specific usage.

domain.caption: Domain
domain.description: The name of the domain. See specific usage.

extension.caption: Schema Extension
extension.description: Extension model that describes agents and its capabilities more in depth.

extensions.caption: Schema Extensions
extensions.description: List of extension models that describe this agent and its capabilities more in depth.

fingerprint.caption: Fingerprint
fingerprint.description: The digital fingerprint associated with an object.

fingerprints.caption: Fingerprints
fingerprints.description: An array of digital fingerprint objects.

framework_config.caption: Agentic Framework Config
framework_config.description: Config for an agent of an agentic framework.

hash.caption: Hash
hash.description: The hash attribute is the value of a digital fingerprint including information about its algorithm.

hostname.caption: Hostname
hostname.description: The hostname of an endpoint or a device.

interrupt_payload.caption: Interrupt Payload
interrupt_payload.description: An instance of an OpenAPI schema object, formatted as per the OpenAPI specs: Schema Object.

interrupt_support.caption: Interrupt Support
interrupt_support.description: This is `true` if the agent runs can interrupt to request additional input and can be subsequently resumed. If missing, it means `false`.

interrupt_type.caption: Interrupt Type
interrupt_type.description: Name of this interrupt type. Needs to be unique in the list of interrupts.

interrupts.caption: Interrupts
interrupts.description: List of possible interrupts that can be provided by the agent. If `interrupts` capability is true, this needs to have at least one item.

locator.caption: Agent Locator
locator.description: Locators provide actual artifact locators of an agent. For example, this can reference sources such as helm charts, docker images, binaries, and so on.

locators.caption: Agent Locators
locators.description: Locators provide actual artifact locators of an agent. For example, this can reference sources such as helm charts, docker images, binaries, and so on.

name.caption: Name
name.description: The name of the entity. See specific usage.

parent_uid.caption: Parent Unique ID
parent_uid.description: The unique identifier of an object's parent object. See specific usage.

path.caption: Path
path.description: The path that pertains to the event or object. See specific usage.

port.caption: Port
port.description: The TCP/UDP port number associated with a connection. See specific usage.

query_string.caption: HTTP Query String
query_string.description: The query portion of the URL. For example: the query portion of the URL http://www.example.com/search?q=bad&sort=date is q=bad&sort=date.

resource_type.caption: Resource Type
resource_type.description: The resource type as defined by the event source.

result_streaming.caption: Result Streaming
result_streaming.description: This is `true` if the agent supports result streaming. If `false` or missing, result streaming is not supported. Result streaming consists of a stream of objects of type `RunResult`, where each one sent over the stream fully replace the previous one.

resume_payload.caption: Resume Payload
resume_payload.description: An instance of an OpenAPI schema object, formatted as per the OpenAPI specs: Schema Object.

scheme.caption: Scheme
scheme.description: The scheme portion of the URL. For example: http, https, ftp, or sftp.

size.caption: Size
size.description: The size of data, in bytes.

skill.caption: Skill
skill.description: A skill that apply to an agent.

skills.caption: Skills
skills.description: Skills that apply to an agent.

specs.caption: Specifications
specs.description: Generic specification schema of this extension.

streaming.caption: Streaming Modes
streaming.description: Supported streaming modes. If missing, streaming is not supported.  If no mode is supported attempts to stream output will result in an error.

subdomain.caption: Subdomain
subdomain.description: The subdomain portion of the URL. For example: sub in https://sub.example.com or sub2.sub1 in https://sub2.sub1.example.com.

thread_state.caption: ThreadState
thread_state.description: This describes the format of ThreadState. Cannot be specified if `threads` capability is false. If not specified, when `threads` capability is true, then the API to retrieve ThreadState from a Thread or a Run is not available. This object contains an instance of an OpenAPI schema object, formatted as per the OpenAPI specs: Schema Object.

threads.caption: Threads
threads.description: This is `true` if the agent supports run threads. If this is `false`, then the threads tagged with `Threads` are not available. If missing, it means `false`.

type.caption: Type
type.description: The type of an object or value, normalized to the caption of the type_id value. In the case of 'Other', it is defined by the event source. See specific usage.

type_id.caption: Type ID
type_id.description: The normalized type identifier of an object. See specific usage.

99.caption: Other
99.description: The type is not mapped. See the type attribute, which contains a data source specific value.

type_name.caption: Type Name
type_name.description: The event/finding type name, as defined by the type_uid.

type_uid.caption: Type ID
type_uid.description: The event/finding type ID. It identifies the event's semantics and structure. The value is calculated by the logging system as: class_uid * 100 + activity_id.

types.caption: Types
types.description: The type/s of an entity. See specific usage.

uid.caption: Unique ID
uid.description: The unique identifier. See specific usage.

unmapped.caption: Unmapped Data
unmapped.description: The attributes that are not mapped to the event schema. The names and values of those attributes are specific to the event source.

url.caption: URL
url.description: The URL object that pertains to the event or object. See specific usage.

url_string.caption: URL String
url_string.description: The URL string. See RFC 1738. For example: http://www.example.com/download/trouble.exe.

version.caption: Version
version.description: The version that pertains to the event or object. See specific usage.

value.caption: Value
value.description: The value associated to an attribute. See specific usage.

types.caption: Data Types
types.description: The data types available in OASF. Each data type specifies constraints in the form regular expressions, max lengths or value limits. Implementers of OASF should ensure they abide to these constraints.

class_t.caption: Class
class_t.description: Name of the class linked to the object.

datetime_t.caption: Datetime
datetime_t.description:
The Internet Date/Time format as defined in RFC-3339. For example:
2024-09-10T23:20:50.520Z,
2024-09-10 23:20:50.520789Z.

file_hash_t.caption: Hash
file_hash_t.description:
Hash. A unique value that corresponds to the content of the file, image, ja3_hash or hassh found in the schema. For example:
MD5: 3172ac7e2b55cbb81f04a6e65855a628.

hostname_t.caption: Hostname
hostname_t.description:
Unique name assigned to a device connected to a computer network. It may be a fully qualified domain name (FQDN). For example:
r2-d2.example.com.,
mx.example.com.

ip_t.caption: IP Address
ip_t.description:
Internet Protocol address (IP address), in either IPv4 or IPv6 format. For example:
192.168.200.24,
2001:0db8:85a3:0000:0000:8a2e:0370:7334.

json_t.caption: JSON
json_t.description: Embedded JSON value. A value can be a string, or a number, or true or false or null, or an object or an array. These structures can be nested. See www.json.org.

resource_uid_t.caption: Resource UID
resource_uid_t.description: Resource unique identifier. For example, S3 Bucket name or EC2 Instance ID.

subnet_t.caption: Subnet
subnet_t.description:
The subnet represented in a CIDR notation, using the format network_address/prefix_length. The network_address can be in either IPv4 or IPv6 format. The prefix length indicates the number of bits used for the network portion, and the remaining bits are available for host addresses within that subnet. For example:
192.168.1.0/24,
2001:0db8:85a3:0000::/64

timestamp_t.caption: Timestamp
timestamp_t.description:
The timestamp format is the number of milliseconds since the Epoch 01/01/1970 00:00:00 UTC. For example:
1618524549901.
